pr_title: Fix conflicting MonitorDomainNames in metrics-common and helix-core

timeline.message: Fix conflicting MonitorDomainNames in metrics-common and helix-core

timeline.bodyText:
Is this a backward compatibility violation?
I think we need a more complete solution to ensure backward compatibility, or we just finish the full migration.
timeline.author: jiajunwang
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,33 +0,0 @@

-/**
- * This enum defines all of domain names used with various Helix monitor mbeans.

-public enum MonitorDomainNames {

replies.bodyText: The key point is, both classes are packaged in org.apache.helix.monitoring.mbeans, so I think it is backward compatible. Although this class is public, client's code doesn't have to change the import. Helix-core.jar depends on helix-common.jar and metrics-common.jar, so it is OK to remove this class in helix-core, as long as we have it in the same package.
replies.author: huizhilu

replies.bodyText:
You are right. I missed the package path.
Since they are the same, it would be fine.
replies.author: jiajunwang
